overall_summary: The reasoning trajectory demonstrates a pragmatic approach to time-series forecasting with limited data (96 hourly points). It begins by assessing data completeness and identifying key patterns, then evaluates multiple modeling approaches before selecting a robust heuristic method to handle outliers and seasonality. The analysis shows strong pattern recognition but simplifies complexity due to data constraints.
common_data_patterns: Time-of-day patterns (lower nighttime, higher daytime/evening values)
Consistent hourly load patterns across days
No missing values in provided data
key_insights: Limited data (4 days) necessitates simpler methods over complex models like SARIMA
Median-based approach effectively mitigates outlier impact while preserving daily patterns
Repeating median hourly values for forecast horizon provides stability
Additive seasonality assumed due to consistent amplitude in daily patterns
Data constraints make trend detection unreliable, favoring pattern repetition
complexity_analysis: Moderately complex: Detailed initial consideration of advanced models (SARIMA, Exponential Smoothing) followed by simplification to heuristic methods due to data limitations and practical constraints.
